Description: Flint knife, bifacially worked, fine denticulations on the upper edge on both sides, the lower part has fine retouch with remnant of notch at squared end.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 7, pl. xxvi.1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
